cyclone.name: MARIA
cyclone.current_location: about 545 miles ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the central Leeward Islands, then through the northeastern Caribbean toward Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Antigua, Barbuda, St. Kitts, Nevis, Montserrat, Guadeloupe, Saba, St. Eustatius, St. Maarten, Anguilla.  Tropical Storm Watch: St. Lucia, Martinique, Dominica, Barbados, St. Vincent and the Grenadines
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central and northern Leeward Islands, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, north coast of Hispaniola
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible if the center tracks close to St. Croix
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of tropical-storm-force winds with 78 % chance; up to 48 % chance of 50-kt winds and 24 % chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large and destructive waves with surge of 3–5 ft possible in exposed south- and east-facing shores
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated totals up to 8 inches, capable of flash flooding and mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Monday; port operations may also be affected by deteriorating seas well ahead of the core
